title: 108_hr2457
content: The "Castillo de San Marcos National Monument Preservation and Education Act" authorizes the design and construction of a Visitor Center at the Monument, following the Preferred Alternative in the General Management Plan. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with various entities for the planning, design, construction, management, and operation of the Visitor Center. SEC. 104. BOUNDARY EXPANSION. The Secretary is authorized to acquire land for the Visitor Center outside the Monument boundary. Newly acquired land will be administered according to laws and regulations, and the Monument boundary will be modified accordingly. SEC. 105. PROJECT APPROVAL. Prior to starting work on the Visitor Center authorized by section 102, the project must be reviewed and approved by the National Park Service in accordance with their construction guidelines. The title of the boundary adjustment act for Castillo de San Marcos National Monument is "Castillo de San Marcos National Monument Boundary Adjustment Act of 2004". The early defense lines for Fort Marion, Florida, now known as Castillo de San Marcos National Monument, extended west to the Sebastian River. During the 1830s Seminole Wars, these defenses were maintained but later fell into disrepair as Florida became more settled. In 1908, the War Department deeded part of the property to St. Johns County, with the remaining federal property now occupied by Orange Street in St. Augustine. The City of St. Augustine has managed Orange Street and utilities in the corridor for almost a century. The City of St. Augustine has managed Orange Street and utilities in the corridor for almost a century. Any archeological remains on the property are protected by the City's ordinances and staff archeologist. It is deemed appropriate for the City to own Orange Street despite operating it under a right-of-way from the National Park Service. SEC. 203. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The Secretary of the Interior will convey Orange Street, a portion of Castillo de San Marcos National Monument, to the City of St. Augustine, Florida. The boundary of the Monument will be revised to exclude the conveyed land and include an additional 0.45 acres. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
